definition: used in place names, notably Kunlun Mountains 崑崙|昆仑[Kun1 lun2]/(also used for transliteration)
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
Karakorum mountain range in west Xinjiang
Karakorum mountain range in west Xinjiang
pinyin: Ka1 la3 kun1 lun2 Shan1 mai4

sentences.english: Akazi pluton, which occurs in Western Kunlun in north of Qinghai-Tibet plateau, is the known oldest pluton in this area.
sentences.chinese: 西崑崙山阿卡孜巖體是該區已知的最古老侵入體。

sentences.english: This essay argues that the name originated from the Wa people, and Goligong is the very Kunlun Mountain in history.
sentences.chinese: 同時認爲，高黎貢山就是我國曆史上所說的崑崙山。

sentences.english: The Huang-yang-lin antimony deposit is newly discovered and is located in the hinterland of the Xinjiang Kunlun Mountains.
sentences.chinese: 黃羊嶺銻礦牀是新疆崑崙山腹地新發現的銻礦產地。

sentences.english: Keriya River is located in south Xinjiang, China.
sentences.chinese: 克里雅河發源於崑崙山脈，位置在新疆的南部。

sentences.english: The Sugaite structural belt in west Xinjiang was located at the front of arcuate nappe outliers of the Kunlun Mountains.
sentences.chinese: 蘇蓋特構造帶位於新疆崑崙山弧形推覆體前緣。

sentences.english: He's believed to live in the Bright Place of Kunlun Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 據傳他住在崑崙山光明頂。

sentences.english: The K2 peak is situated on the Pak-China border in the mighty Karakoram range.
sentences.chinese: 喬戈裏頂峯處於雄偉的喀喇崑崙山脈的中巴邊境上。

sentences.english: From the boundless expanse of the east coast to the mountains of Kunlun Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 從浩瀚無垠的東海之濱到巍峨的崑崙山下。

sentences.english: Kunlun Mountains angel came to earth.
sentences.chinese: 崑崙山的天女來到了人間。

sentences.english: Coming from the ivory comb _insert_ed alone, the Kunlun mountains next month.
sentences.chinese: 獨把象牙梳插鬢，崑崙山上月初明。

sentences.english: Several sections were set up to observe the air temperature and ground temperature in Kunlunshan tunnel.
sentences.chinese: 在崑崙山隧道洞內設置了地溫及氣溫觀測斷面。

definition: Daxing'anling mountain range in northwest Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1] in northeast China/Daxing'anling prefecture
Qilian county in Haibei Tibetan autonomous prefecture 海北藏族自治州[Hai3 bei3 Zang4 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Qinghai
to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
Sêrtar county (Tibetan: gser thar rdzong) in Garze Tibetan autonomous prefecture 甘孜藏族自治州[Gan1 zi1 Zang4 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Sichuan (formerly in Kham province of Tibet)

pinyin: Xi3 ma3 la1 ya3 shan1 mai4

definition: Donghe or Tungho township in Taitung County 臺東縣|台东县[Tai2 dong1 Xian4], southeast Taiwan
Yumen Pass, or Jade Gate, western frontier post on the Silk Road in the Han Dynasty, west of Dunhuang, in Gansu

Ngawa Tibetan and Qiang autonomous prefecture (Tibetan: rnga ba bod rigs cha'ng rigs rang skyong khul, formerly in Kham province of Tibet), northwest Sichuan, capital Barkam 馬爾康鎮|马尔康镇[Ma3 er3 kang1 zhen4]/also Ngawa county
